verses.text:
The words of Amos, who was among the herdmen of Tekoa, which he
saw concerning Israel in the days of Uzziah king of Judah, and in the
days of Jeroboam the son of Joash king of Israel, two years before
the earthquake.

And he said, The \nd LORD\nd* will roar from Zion, and utter
his voice from Jerusalem; and the habitations of the shepherds shall
mourn, and the top of Carmel shall wither.

Thus saith the \nd LORD\nd*; For three transgressions of Damascus,
and for four, I will not turn away \add the punishment\add* thereof; because they have
threshed Gilead with threshing instruments of iron:\f + \fr 1.3 
\ft and…: or, yea, for four\f*\f + \fr 1.3  \ft turn…: or, convert it, or, let it be
quiet\f*

But I will send a fire into the house of Hazael, which shall
devour the palaces of Ben-hadad.

I will break also the bar of Damascus, and cut off the inhabitant
from the plain of Aven, and him that holdeth the sceptre from the
house of Eden: and the people of Syria shall go into captivity unto
Kir, saith the \nd LORD\nd*.\f + \fr 1.5  \ft the plain…: or, Bikathaven\f*\f + \fr 1.5 
\ft the house…: or, Beth-eden\f*

Thus saith the \nd LORD\nd*; For three transgressions of Gaza,
and for four, I will not turn away \add the punishment\add* thereof; because they carried away
captive the whole captivity, to deliver \add them\add* up to Edom:\f + \fr 1.6 
\ft away captive…: or, them away with an entire\f*

But I will send a fire on the wall of Gaza, which shall devour
the palaces thereof:

And I will cut off the inhabitant from Ashdod, and him that
holdeth the sceptre from Ashkelon, and I will turn mine hand against
Ekron: and the remnant of the Philistines shall perish, saith the
Lord \nd GOD\nd*.

Thus saith the \nd LORD\nd*; For three transgressions of Tyrus,
and for four, I will not turn away \add the punishment\add* thereof; because they delivered
up the whole captivity to Edom, and remembered not the brotherly
covenant:\f + \fr 1.9  \ft the brotherly…: Heb. the covenant of brethren\f*

But I will send a fire on the wall of Tyrus, which shall devour
the palaces thereof.

Thus saith the \nd LORD\nd*; For three transgressions of
Edom, and for four, I will not turn away \add the punishment\add*
thereof; because he did pursue his brother with the sword, and did cast
off all pity, and his anger did tear perpetually, and he kept his
wrath for ever:\f + \fr 1.11  \ft did cast…: Heb. corrupted his compassions\f*

But I will send a fire upon Teman, which shall devour the
palaces of Bozrah.

Thus saith the \nd LORD\nd*; For three transgressions of the
children of Ammon, and for four, I will not turn away \add the punishment\add*
thereof; because they have ripped up the women with child of Gilead,
that they might enlarge their border:\f + \fr 1.13  \ft ripped…: or, divided the
mountains\f*

But I will kindle a fire in the wall of Rabbah, and it shall
devour the palaces thereof, with shouting in the day of battle, with a
tempest in the day of the whirlwind:

And their king shall go into captivity, he and his princes
together, saith the \nd LORD\nd*.

Thus saith the \nd LORD\nd*; For three transgressions of Moab,
and for four, I will not turn away \add the punishment\add* thereof; because he
burned the bones of the king of Edom into lime:

But I will send a fire upon Moab, and it shall devour the palaces
of Kerioth: and Moab shall die with tumult, with shouting, \add and\add*
with the sound of the trumpet:

And I will cut off the judge from the midst thereof, and will
slay all the princes thereof with him, saith the \nd LORD\nd*.

Thus saith the \nd LORD\nd*; For three transgressions of Judah,
and for four, I will not turn away \add the punishment\add* thereof; because they have
despised the law of the \nd LORD\nd*, and have not kept his commandments,
and their lies caused them to err, after the which their fathers
have walked:

But I will send a fire upon Judah, and it shall devour the
palaces of Jerusalem.

That pant after the dust of the earth on the head of the poor,
and turn aside the way of the meek: and a man and his father will
go in unto the \add same\add* maid, to profane my holy name:\f + \fr 2.7 
\ft maid: or, young woman\f*

And they lay \add themselves\add* down upon clothes laid to
pledge by every altar, and they drink the wine of the condemned \add in\add*
the house of their god.\f + \fr 2.8  \ft the condemned: or, such as have fined, or,
mulcted\f*

Yet destroyed I the Amorite before them, whose height \add was\add*
like the height of the cedars, and he \add was\add* strong as the
oaks; yet I destroyed his fruit from above, and his roots from beneath.

Also I brought you up from the land of Egypt, and led you
forty years through the wilderness, to possess the land of the Amorite.

And I raised up of your sons for prophets, and of your young
men for Nazarites. \add Is it\add* not even thus, O ye children of
Israel? saith the \nd LORD\nd*.

But ye gave the Nazarites wine to drink; and commanded the
prophets, saying, Prophesy not.

Behold, I am pressed under you, as a cart is pressed \add that
is\add* full of sheaves.\f + \fr 2.13  \ft I am…: or, I will press your place, as a cart full of sheaves
presseth\f*

Therefore the flight shall perish from the swift, and the
strong shall not strengthen his force, neither shall the mighty deliver
himself:\f + \fr 2.14  \ft himself: Heb. his soul, or, life\f*

Neither shall he stand that handleth the bow; and \add he that
is\add* swift of foot shall not deliver \add himself:\add* neither shall he that
rideth the horse deliver himself.

And \add he that is\add* courageous among the mighty shall flee
away naked in that day, saith the \nd LORD\nd*.\f + \fr 2.16  \ft courageous: Heb. strong of his
heart\f*

Hear this word that the \nd LORD\nd* hath spoken against you, O
children of Israel, against the whole family which I brought up from the
land of Egypt, saying,

You only have I known of all the families of the earth: therefore I will
punish you for all your iniquities.\f + \fr 3.2  \ft punish: Heb. visit
upon\f*
Can two walk together, except they be agreed?

Will a lion roar in the forest, when he hath no prey? will a young
lion cry out of his den, if he have taken nothing?\f + \fr 3.4  \ft cry: Heb. give forth his
voice\f*

Can a bird fall in a snare upon the earth, where no gin \add is\add* for him? shall
\add one\add* take up a snare from the earth, and have taken nothing at
all?

Shall a trumpet be blown in the city, and the people not be
afraid? shall there be evil in a city, and the \nd LORD\nd* hath not
done \add it\add*?\f + \fr 3.6  \ft be afraid: or, run together?\f*\f + \fr 3.6 
\ft the \+nd LORD\+nd*…: or, shall not the \+nd LORD\+nd* do somewhat?\f*

Surely the Lord \nd GOD\nd* will do nothing, but he revealeth
his secret unto his servants the prophets.

The lion hath roared, who will not fear? the Lord \nd GOD\nd*
hath spoken, who can but prophesy?

Publish in the palaces at Ashdod, and in the palaces in the
land of Egypt, and say, Assemble yourselves upon the mountains of
Samaria, and behold the great tumults in the midst thereof, and the
oppressed in the midst thereof.\f + \fr 3.9  \ft oppressed: or, oppressions\f*

For they know not to do right, saith the \nd LORD\nd*, who
store up violence and robbery in their palaces.\f + \fr 3.10  \ft robbery: or,
spoil\f*

Therefore thus saith the Lord \nd GOD\nd*; An adversary \add there shall
be\add* even round about the land; and he shall bring down thy strength
from thee, and thy palaces shall be spoiled.

Thus saith the \nd LORD\nd*; As the shepherd taketh out of the
mouth of the lion two legs, or a piece of an ear; so shall the children
of Israel be taken out that dwell in Samaria in the corner of a bed,
and in Damascus \add in\add* a couch.\f + \fr 3.12  \ft taketh: Heb.
delivereth\f*\f + \fr 3.12  \ft in Damascus…: or, on the bed’s feet\f*

Hear ye, and testify in the house of Jacob, saith the Lord
\nd GOD\nd*, the God of hosts,

That in the day that I shall visit the transgressions of Israel
upon him I will also visit the altars of Beth-el: and the horns of the
altar shall be cut off, and fall to the ground.\f + \fr 3.14  \ft visit: or, punish Israel
for\f*

And I will smite the winter house with the summer house; and the
houses of ivory shall perish, and the great houses shall have an
end, saith the \nd LORD\nd*.

Hear this word, ye kine of Bashan, that \add are\add* in the
mountain of Samaria, which oppress the poor, which crush the needy,
which say to their masters, Bring, and let us drink.

The Lord \nd GOD\nd* hath sworn by his holiness, that, lo, the
days shall come upon you, that he will take you away with hooks,
and your posterity with fishhooks.

And ye shall go out at the breaches, every \add cow at that which
is\add* before her; and ye shall cast \add them\add* into the palace,
saith the \nd LORD\nd*.\f + \fr 4.3  \ft cast…: or, cast away the things of the
palace\f*

And offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving with leaven, and proclaim
\add and\add* publish the free offerings: for this liketh you, O ye
children of Israel, saith the Lord \nd GOD\nd*.\f + \fr 4.5  \ft offer: Heb. offer by
burning\f*\f + \fr 4.5  \ft this…: Heb. so ye love\f*

And I also have given you cleanness of teeth in all your cities,
and want of bread in all your places: yet have ye not returned unto me,
saith the \nd LORD\nd*.

And also I have withholden the rain from you, when \add there
were\add* yet three months to the harvest: and I caused it to rain
upon one city, and caused it not to rain upon another city: one piece
was rained upon, and the piece whereupon it rained not withered.

So two \add or\add* three cities wandered unto one city, to
drink water; but they were not satisfied: yet have ye not returned
unto me, saith the \nd LORD\nd*.

I have smitten you with blasting and mildew: when your gardens
and your vineyards and your fig trees and your olive trees increased,
the palmerworm devoured \add them:\add* yet have ye not returned
unto me, saith the \nd LORD\nd*.\f + \fr 4.9  \ft when…: or, the multitude of your gardens, etc. did the
palmerworm\f*

I have sent among you the pestilence after the manner of Egypt:
your young men have I slain with the sword, and have taken away your
horses; and I have made the stink of your camps to come up unto your
nostrils: yet have ye not returned unto me, saith the \nd LORD\nd*.\f + \fr 4.10 
\ft after…: or, in the way\f*\f + \fr 4.10  \ft and have…: Heb. with the captivity of your
horses\f*

I have overthrown \add some\add* of you, as God overthrew
Sodom and Gomorrah, and ye were as a firebrand plucked out of the
burning: yet have ye not returned unto me, saith the \nd LORD\nd*.

Therefore thus will I do unto thee, O Israel: \add and\add*
because I will do this unto thee, prepare to meet thy God, O Israel.

For, lo, he that formeth the mountains, and createth the wind,
and declareth unto man what \add is\add* his thought, that maketh
the morning darkness, and treadeth upon the high places of the earth,
The \nd LORD\nd*, The God of hosts, \add is\add* his name.\f + \fr 4.13 
\ft wind: or, spirit\f*

Hear ye this word which I take up against you, \add even\add*
a lamentation, O house of Israel.

The virgin of Israel is fallen; she shall no more rise: she is
forsaken upon her land; \add there is\add* none to raise her up.

For thus saith the Lord \nd GOD\nd*; The city that went out
\add by\add* a thousand shall leave an hundred, and that which went
forth \add by\add* an hundred shall leave ten, to the house of Israel.

For thus saith the \nd LORD\nd* unto the house of Israel,
Seek ye me, and ye shall live:

But seek not Beth-el, nor enter into Gilgal, and pass not to
Beer-sheba: for Gilgal shall surely go into captivity, and Beth-el
shall come to nought.

Seek the \nd LORD\nd*, and ye shall live; lest he break out
like fire in the house of Joseph, and devour \add it\add*, and \add there
be\add* none to quench \add it\add* in Beth-el.

Ye who turn judgment to wormwood, and leave off righteousness
in the earth,

\add Seek him\add* that maketh the seven stars and Orion, and
turneth the shadow of death into the morning, and maketh the day
dark with night: that calleth for the waters of the sea, and poureth them
out upon the face of the earth: The \nd LORD\nd* \add is\add* his
name:

That strengtheneth the spoiled against the strong, so that the
spoiled shall come against the fortress.\f + \fr 5.9  \ft spoiled: Heb.
spoil\f*

They hate him that rebuketh in the gate, and they abhor him that
speaketh uprightly.

Forasmuch therefore as your treading \add is\add* upon the
poor, and ye take from him burdens of wheat: ye have built houses
of hewn stone, but ye shall not dwell in them; ye have planted pleasant
vineyards, but ye shall not drink wine of them.\f + \fr 5.11  \ft pleasant…: Heb. vineyards of
desire\f*

For I know your manifold transgressions and your mighty sins:
they afflict the just, they take a bribe, and they turn aside the
poor in the gate \add from their right\add*.\f + \fr 5.12  \ft a bribe: or, a
ransom\f*

Therefore the prudent shall keep silence in that time; for it
\add is\add* an evil time.

Seek good, and not evil, that ye may live: and so the \nd LORD\nd*,
the God of hosts, shall be with you, as ye have spoken.

Hate the evil, and love the good, and establish judgment in the
gate: it may be that the \nd LORD\nd* God of hosts will be gracious
unto the remnant of Joseph.

Therefore the \nd LORD\nd*, the God of hosts, the Lord, saith
thus; Wailing \add shall be\add* in all streets; and they shall say
in all the highways, Alas! alas! and they shall call the husbandman
to mourning, and such as are skilful of lamentation to wailing.

And in all vineyards \add shall be\add* wailing: for I will
pass through thee, saith the \nd LORD\nd*.

Woe unto you that desire the day of the 
d LORD
d*! to what
end \add is\add* it for you? the day of the 
d LORD
d* \add is\add*
darkness, and not light.

As if a man did flee from a lion, and a bear met him; or went
into the house, and leaned his hand on the wall, and a serpent bit him.

\add Shall\add* not the day of the \nd LORD\nd* \add be\add*
darkness, and not light? even very dark, and no brightness in it?

I hate, I despise your feast days, and I will not smell in your solemn
assemblies.\f + \fr 5.21  \ft in…: or, your holy days\f*

Though ye offer me burnt offerings and your meat offerings,
I will not accept \add them:\add* neither will I regard the peace
offerings of your fat beasts.\f + \fr 5.22  \ft peace…: or, thank
offerings\f*

Take thou away from me the noise of thy songs; for I will not
hear the melody of thy viols.

But let judgment run down as waters, and righteousness as a
mighty stream.\f + \fr 5.24  \ft run: Heb. roll\f*

Have ye offered unto me sacrifices and offerings in the wilderness
forty years, O house of Israel?

But ye have borne the tabernacle of your Moloch and Chiun
your images, the star of your god, which ye made to yourselves.\f + \fr 5.26 
\ft the tabernacle…: or, Siccuth your king\f*

Therefore will I cause you to go into captivity beyond Damascus,
saith the \nd LORD\nd*, whose name \add is\add* The God of hosts.

Woe to them \add that are\add* at ease in Zion, and trust in the
mountain of Samaria, \add which are\add* named chief of the nations,
to whom the house of Israel came!\f + \fr 6.1  \ft are at…: or, are
secure\f*\f + \fr 6.1  \ft chief: or, firstfruits\f*

Pass ye unto Calneh, and see; and from thence go ye to Hamath
the great: then go down to Gath of the Philistines: \add be they\add*
better than these kingdoms? or their border greater than your border?

Ye that put far away the evil day, and cause the seat of violence
to come near;\f + \fr 6.3  \ft seat: or, habitation\f*

That lie upon beds of ivory, and stretch themselves upon their
couches, and eat the lambs out of the flock, and the calves out of the
midst of the stall;\f + \fr 6.4  \ft stretch…: or, abound with superfluities\f*

That chant to the sound of the viol, \add and\add* invent to themselves
instruments of musick, like David;\f + \fr 6.5  \ft chant: or, quaver\f*

That drink wine in bowls, and anoint themselves with the chief
ointments: but they are not grieved for the affliction of Joseph.\f + \fr 6.6 
\ft wine…: or, in bowls of wine\f*\f + \fr 6.6  \ft affliction: Heb.
breach\f*

Therefore now shall they go captive with the first that go
captive, and the banquet of them that stretched themselves shall be
removed.

The Lord \nd GOD\nd* hath sworn by himself, saith the \nd LORD\nd*
the God of hosts, I abhor the excellency of Jacob, and hate his palaces:
therefore will I deliver up the city with all that is therein.\f + \fr 6.8 
\ft that…: Heb. the fulness thereof\f*

And it shall come to pass, if there remain ten men in one house,
that they shall die.

And a man’s uncle shall take him up, and he that burneth him, to bring
out the bones out of the house, and shall say unto him that \add is\add*
by the sides of the house, \add Is there\add* yet \add any\add* with thee? and he shall
say, No. Then shall he say, Hold thy tongue: for we may not make
mention of the name of the \nd LORD\nd*.\f + \fr 6.10  \ft we…: or, they will not, or, have
not\f*

For, behold, the \nd LORD\nd* commandeth, and he will smite
the great house with breaches, and the little house with clefts.\f + \fr 6.11 
\ft breaches: or, droppings\f*

Shall horses run upon the rock? will \add one\add* plow \add there\add*
with oxen? for ye have turned judgment into gall, and the fruit of
righteousness into hemlock:

Ye which rejoice in a thing of nought, which say, Have we not
taken to us horns by our own strength?

But, behold, I will raise up against you a nation, O house
of Israel, saith the \nd LORD\nd* the God of hosts; and they shall
afflict you from the entering in of Hemath unto the river of the
wilderness.\f + \fr 6.14  \ft river: or, valley\f*

Thus hath the Lord \nd GOD\nd* shewed unto me; and, behold, he
formed grasshoppers in the beginning of the shooting up of the latter
growth; and, lo, \add it was\add* the latter growth after the king’s
mowings.\f + \fr 7.1  \ft grasshoppers: or, green worms\f*

And it came to pass, \add that\add* when they had made an end
of eating the grass of the land, then I said, O Lord \nd GOD\nd*,
forgive, I beseech thee: by whom shall Jacob arise? for he \add is\add*
small.\f + \fr 7.2  \ft by…: or, who of (or, for,) Jacob shall stand?\f*

The 
d LORD
d* repented for this: It shall not be, saith
the 
d LORD
d*.

Thus hath the Lord 
d GOD
d* shewed unto me: and, behold, the
Lord 
d GOD
d* called to contend by fire, and it devoured the great
deep, and did eat up a part.

Then said I, O Lord \nd GOD\nd*, cease, I beseech thee: by whom shall
Jacob arise? for he \add is\add* small.\f + \fr 7.5  \ft by…: or, who of (or, for,) Jacob shall
stand?\f*

The 
d LORD
d* repented for this: This also shall not be,
saith the Lord 
d GOD
d*.

Thus he shewed me: and, behold, the Lord stood upon a wall
\add made\add* by a plumbline, with a plumbline in his hand.

And the \nd LORD\nd* said unto me, Amos, what seest thou? And I
said, A plumbline. Then said the Lord, Behold, I will set a plumbline
in the midst of my people Israel: I will not again pass by them any more:

And the high places of Isaac shall be desolate, and the sanctuaries
of Israel shall be laid waste; and I will rise against the house
of Jeroboam with the sword.

Then Amaziah the priest of Beth-el sent to Jeroboam king
of Israel, saying, Amos hath conspired against thee in the midst
of the house of Israel: the land is not able to bear all his words.

For thus Amos saith, Jeroboam shall die by the sword, and
Israel shall surely be led away captive out of their own land.

Also Amaziah said unto Amos, O thou seer, go, flee thee away
into the land of Judah, and there eat bread, and prophesy there:

But prophesy not again any more at Beth-el: for it \add is\add*
the king’s chapel, and it \add is\add* the king’s court.\f + \fr 7.13 
\ft chapel: or, sanctuary\f*\f + \fr 7.13  \ft king’s court: Heb. house of the
kingdom\f*

Then answered Amos, and said to Amaziah, I \add was\add*
no prophet, neither \add was\add* I a prophet’s son; but I \add was\add*
an herdman, and a gatherer of sycomore fruit:\f + \fr 7.14  \ft sycomore…: or, wild
figs\f*

And the \nd LORD\nd* took me as I followed the flock, and the
\nd LORD\nd* said unto me, Go, prophesy unto my people Israel.\f + \fr 7.15 
\ft as…: Heb. from behind\f*

Now therefore hear thou the word of the \nd LORD\nd*: Thou
sayest, Prophesy not against Israel, and drop not \add thy word\add*
against the house of Isaac.

Therefore thus saith the \nd LORD\nd*; Thy wife shall be an
harlot in the city, and thy sons and thy daughters shall fall by the
sword, and thy land shall be divided by line; and thou shalt die
in a polluted land: and Israel shall surely go into captivity forth of his
land.

Thus hath the Lord \nd GOD\nd* shewed unto me: and behold a
basket of summer fruit.

And he said, Amos, what seest thou? And I said, A basket of summer
fruit. Then said the \nd LORD\nd* unto me, The end is come upon my
people of Israel; I will not again pass by them any more.

And the songs of the temple shall be howlings in that day,
saith the Lord \nd GOD\nd*: \add there shall be\add* many dead bodies
in every place; they shall cast \add them\add* forth with silence.\f + \fr 8.3 
\ft shall be howlings: Heb. shall howl\f*\f + \fr 8.3  \ft with…: Heb. be
silent\f*

Hear this, O ye that swallow up the needy, even to make the
poor of the land to fail,

Saying, When will the new moon be gone, that we may sell corn?
and the sabbath, that we may set forth wheat, making the ephah small,
and the shekel great, and falsifying the balances by deceit?\f + \fr 8.5 
\ft new…: or, month\f*\f + \fr 8.5  \ft set…: Heb. open\f*\f + \fr 8.5 
\ft falsifying…: Heb. perverting the balances of deceit\f*

That we may buy the poor for silver, and the needy for a pair of
shoes; \add yea\add*, and sell the refuse of the wheat?

The \nd LORD\nd* hath sworn by the excellency of Jacob, Surely I will
never forget any of their works.

Shall not the land tremble for this, and every one mourn that
dwelleth therein? and it shall rise up wholly as a flood; and it shall be cast
out and drowned, as \add by\add* the flood of Egypt.

And it shall come to pass in that day, saith the Lord \nd GOD\nd*,
that I will cause the sun to go down at noon, and I will darken the
earth in the clear day:

And I will turn your feasts into mourning, and all your songs
into lamentation; and I will bring up sackcloth upon all loins, and
baldness upon every head; and I will make it as the mourning of an
only \add son\add*, and the end thereof as a bitter day.

Behold, the days come, saith the Lord 
d GOD
d*, that I will
send a famine in the land, not a famine of bread, nor a thirst for
water, but of hearing the words of the 
d LORD
d*:

And they shall wander from sea to sea, and from the north
even to the east, they shall run to and fro to seek the word of the
\nd LORD\nd*, and shall not find \add it\add*.

In that day shall the fair virgins and young men faint for
thirst.

They that swear by the sin of Samaria, and say, Thy god, O
Dan, liveth; and, The manner of Beer-sheba liveth; even they shall
fall, and never rise up again.\f + \fr 8.14  \ft manner: Heb. way\f*

I saw the Lord standing upon the altar: and he said, Smite
the lintel of the door, that the posts may shake: and cut them in the
head, all of them; and I will slay the last of them with the sword:
he that fleeth of them shall not flee away, and he that escapeth
of them shall not be delivered.\f + \fr 9.1  \ft lintel: or, chapiter, or,
knop\f*\f + \fr 9.1  \ft cut…: or, wound them\f*

Though they dig into hell, thence shall mine hand take them; though they climb
up to heaven, thence will I bring them down:

And though they hide themselves in the top of Carmel, I will
search and take them out thence; and though they be hid from my sight
in the bottom of the sea, thence will I command the serpent, and he shall
bite them:

And though they go into captivity before their enemies, thence will I
command the sword, and it shall slay them: and I will set mine eyes
upon them for evil, and not for good.

And the Lord \nd GOD\nd* of hosts \add is\add* he that toucheth
the land, and it shall melt, and all that dwell therein shall mourn:
and it shall rise up wholly like a flood; and shall be drowned, as
\add by\add* the flood of Egypt.

\add It is\add* he that buildeth his stories in the heaven,
and hath founded his troop in the earth; he that calleth for the
waters of the sea, and poureth them out upon the face of the earth:
The \nd LORD\nd* \add is\add* his name.\f + \fr 9.6  \ft stories: or, spheres: Heb.
ascensions\f*\f + \fr 9.6  \ft troop: or, bundle\f*

\add Are\add* ye not as children of the Ethiopians unto me, O
children of Israel? saith the \nd LORD\nd*. Have not I brought up
Israel out of the land of Egypt? and the Philistines from Caphtor,
and the Syrians from Kir?

Behold, the eyes of the Lord \nd GOD\nd* \add are\add* upon the
sinful kingdom, and I will destroy it from off the face of the earth;
saving that I will not utterly destroy the house of Jacob, saith
the \nd LORD\nd*.

For, lo, I will command, and I will sift the house of Israel
among all nations, like as \add corn\add* is sifted in a sieve, yet shall not the least
grain fall upon the earth.\f + \fr 9.9  \ft sift: Heb. cause to move\f*\f + \fr 9.9 
\ft grain: Heb. stone\f*

All the sinners of my people shall die by the sword, which
say, The evil shall not overtake nor prevent us.

In that day will I raise up the tabernacle of David that is
fallen, and close up the breaches thereof; and I will raise up his
ruins, and I will build it as in the days of old:\f + \fr 9.11  \ft close: Heb. hedge, or,
wall\f*

That they may possess the remnant of Edom, and of all the
heathen, which are called by my name, saith the \nd LORD\nd* that
doeth this.\f + \fr 9.12  \ft which…: Heb. upon whom my name is called\f*

Behold, the days come, saith the \nd LORD\nd*, that the plowman
shall overtake the reaper, and the treader of grapes him that soweth
seed; and the mountains shall drop sweet wine, and all the hills
shall melt.\f + \fr 9.13  \ft soweth: Heb. draweth forth\f*\f + \fr 9.13 
\ft sweet: or, new\f*

And I will bring again the captivity of my people of Israel,
and they shall build the waste cities, and inhabit \add them;\add*
and they shall plant vineyards, and drink the wine thereof; they shall also
make gardens, and eat the fruit of them.

And I will plant them upon their land, and they shall no more be pulled
up out of their land which I have given them, saith the \nd LORD\nd*
thy God.
